attributes.description:
Riders looking to exit the Red Line at Central should exit at Kendall. Shuttle pick-up is located at Main St near station entrance for Alewife platform. Riders looking to board at Central should use shuttle service to Kendall. Shuttle pick-up is located on Mass Ave near Elevator 861. Please see an MBTA employee or access a station call box to request shuttle at both Central and Kendall.

Unavailable Elevator:
Central Elevator 861 (Ashmont/Braintree platform to street)

Changes like this will help improve the reliability and flexibility of our bus system, and are based on feedback from over 3,000 MBTA bus riders like you, along with planners, drivers and consultants.

attributes.description:
Additional weekends may be added to the train service suspension between Forge Park/495 and Readville as work progresses on the Franklin line.

Please visit https://www.mbta.com/FRKwork for more details about bus shuttle schedules. Visit MBTA.com/PTC for more information on how this project will improve commuter rail safety and travel. Passengers may experience delays of up to 30 minutes as a result of shuttle bus connections. 

There will be no Franklin line service at Back Bay and Ruggles stations on weekends. Please travel to South Station to reach a Franklin Line station. If you are travelling inbound, please board a Worcester/Framingham line Train for direct connection to Back Bay or a Providence/Stoughton line Train for a direct connection to Back Bay or Ruggles. 

We also recommend the subway: board the Red Line at South Station and transfer to the Orange Line at Downtown Crossing to reach Back Bay or Ruggles. 

Due to proximity of adjacent stations, bus shuttles will not serve Endicott, Islington and Norwood Depot stations: 
-Endicott station customers, please use Readville or Dedham Corp stations. 
-Islington station customers, please use Dedham Corp station. 
-Norwood Depot customers, please use Norwood Central or Dedham Corp station. 

8:40pm and 10:40pm departures from Forge Park as well as 11:20pm departure from South Station will be accommodated by a bus for the entire trip between South Station and Forge Park (including the portion between South Station and Readville). 

Thank you for your patience while we improve the signal system on your Commuter Rail line.
attributes.header: Weekends, through Dec 22, Franklin Train service is replaced by free buses between Forge Park/495 and Readville for a Fairmount Line connection while PTC is installed. There will be no service at Back Bay, Ruggles, Endicott, Islington and Norwood Depot.

attributes.description:
During garage construction, 592 spots at the North Quincy Hancock Street lot will be unavailable. More than 600 spots will be available in two surface lots: 
350 spots at Newport Avenue lot 
260 spots at Hancock Street lot 

On weekdays, the Hancock Street lot typically fills by about 7:30 AM, and the Newport Avenue lot fills between 7:45 & 8 AM.

Alternative parking and travel options include: 
403 spots at Wollaston Station during the station closure, with free shuttle service between North Quincy, Quincy Center, and Wollaston Stations.

For more information visit: www.mbta.com/northquincy
attributes.header: Parking has been reduced in the North Quincy Hancock Street Parking Lot to 260 parking spots due to construction of a new garage and mixed retail and residential use building.

attributes.description:
Bus shuttles skip Beaconsfied due to narrow roads and shuttles cannot safely stop there. We recommend:
- Taking the Green Line C branch to Dean Road, about a 4-minute walk from Beaconsfield
- Accessing the Green Line D shuttle from Reservoir, about a 10-minute walk from Beaconsfield
All bus shuttles and stops are fully accessible. Please plan for additional travel time.

Affected stops:
Kenmore
Fenway
Longwood
Brookline Village
Brookline Hills
Beaconsfield
Reservoir
Chestnut Hill
Newton Centre
Newton Highlands

attributes.description:
Please plan for extra travel time. All buses and stops fully accessible. Please see an MBTA employee for assistance.

No Shuttles at Beaconsfield:
Why do shuttles skip Beaconsfield? Due to narrow roads near Beaconsfield, shuttles cannot safely stop there. 
We recommend:
- Taking the Green Line C branch from Dean Road, about a 4-minute walk from Beaconsfield
- Accessing the Green Line D shuttle from Reservoir, about a 10-minute walk from Beaconsfield

Affected stops:
Kenmore
Fenway
Longwood
Brookline Village
Brookline Hills
Beaconsfield
Reservoir
Chestnut Hill
Newton Centre
Newton Highlands

attributes.description:
Orange Line: Bus shuttle is available upon request to/from Ruggles and Jackson.

Request the shuttle from an MBTA employee or station call box. These elevators are closed through Summer 2020.

Traveling to Ruggles: 
Riders looking to travel to Ruggles should take the train to Jackson Square where a shuttle bus will bring them to Ruggles. The Jackson Square shuttle pick-up location is in the busway adjacent to the station entrance to the mezzanine.

Traveling from Ruggles:
Riders looking to board at Ruggles can use a shuttle bus to Jackson Square or accessible van service in the cul-de-sac adjacent to the station entrance on Forsyth St. The elevator bus pick-up location is in the Ruggles Upper Busway. Riders boarding the accessible van at the Forsyth St. entrance may be transported directly to Jackson Square Station upon request.


Affected elevators:
Elevator 850 Orange Line platform to upper lobby
Elevator 851 Forsyth St to upper lobby
attributes.header: There is no elevator access at Ruggles from the Orange Line or Forsyth St (Northeastern Campus) while the elevators are being replaced. Bus shuttles are available for passengers traveling to/from Ruggles. Access is available from Commuter Rail.
attributes.short_header: There is no elev. access at Ruggles from the Orange Ln or Forsyth St while the elevators are being replaced. Bus shuttles are available.

attributes.description:
From Route 3, drivers can continue straight on Union Street and use the left 2 lanes to turn left onto Ivory Street. From Ivory Street, take a right to enter the garage and station area. For the drop-off/pick-up area, follow signs to the 2nd level of the garage.

Access for RIDE vans and other ADA compliant vans will remain from the ramp to the busway for both parking and drop-offs/pick-ups.

New steps to access the station are scheduled to open on Monday, December 16. New crosswalks and access improvements will be in place as well. 

The Route 3 flyover ramp to the 2nd level of the Braintree Garage is closed due to construction for the South Shore Parking Garages Improvements and Renovations Project. Learn more at: mbta.com/southshore

attributes.description:
Due to MassDOT's Tobin Bridge/Chelsea Curves Rehabilitation Project, the Route 1 northbound lane closure will be extended through Chelsea and a southbound lane on the Tobin Bridge will be closed effective May 13. We expect this work will cause significant delays to buses on these roads, including Routes 111, 426, and 428.  

For the Route 111, alternate service options include: 
Commuter Rail: For service to downtown Boston and connections to the Green and Orange Lines. Customers may show their CharlieCard to the conductor for travel between Chelsea and North Station, a 10-minute trip. Parking is not available at Chelsea Station. 

Silver Line - SL3: SL3 connects to the Blue Line (via Airport Station), Red Line (via South Station), and the Commuter Rail at Chelsea Station, along with other Silver Line routes. Monthly LinkPasses are valid for travel on the SL3 and subway. Inbound SL3 fares are being waived from Chelsea, Bellingham Square, Box District, and Eastern Ave during construction. 

Subway: For Blue Line service, take bus Routes 114, 116, or 117 to Maverick or the SL3 to Airport Station. For Red Line, take the SL3 to South Station. For Orange Line, take the Routes 110 or 112 to Wellington. Monthly LinkPasses are valid for travel on the SL3 and subway. Monthly local bus passes are not accepted on SL3 or subway. 

For more information on alternate routes and construction, visit www.mbta.com/tobinbridge
attributes.header: Since May 13, delays on the Route 111 bus are expected due to additional lane closures on Route 1 in Chelsea & the Tobin Bridge. Riders are advised to seek alternate routes, especially during peak hours. MBTA.com/tobinbridge

attributes.description:
Shuttles will be available at the intersection of Burning Tree, Boden Lane, and Tamarack. The shuttle signs will read Boden Lane Shuttle.

Residents who normally walk over the bridge to get to the West Natick Train Station are encouraged to utilize the shuttle service while the Town of Natick works with our Commonwealth partners to create other solutions. There is no cost to residents to utilize the shuttle service.  Again, we very much appreciate your patience and understanding.


Affected routes:
Framingham/Worcester Line

attributes.description:
Diversion begins at 8:45 PM on Fridays and at all times on Saturdays and Sundays. Regularly scheduled train service begins at the start of service on Mondays. 

Shuttle buses will be provided between Kendall/MIT and Broadway. Due to one-way traffic patterns: 
- For shuttle service toward Alewife, there is no shuttle stop at Park Street 
- For shuttle service toward Ashmont/Braintree, there is no shuttle stop at Downtown Crossing 

Alewife-bound (northbound) bus shuttle locations: 
Broadway (West Broadway, outside of station entrance) 
South Station (Summer St @ Atlantic Ave) 
Downtown Crossing (Federal St @ Franklin St) 
Government Center (near Cambridge St @ Government Center) 
Charles/MGH (near 325 Cambridge St) 
Kendall/MIT (Main St @ Dock St) 

Ashmont/Braintree-bound (southbound) bus shuttle locations: 
Kendall/MIT (Main St between the end of scaffolding and Ames St) 
Charles/MGH (Cambridge St between Cedar St & Grove St) 
Park St (Tremont St @ Temple Pl) 
South Station (Summer St @ Atlantic Ave) 
Broadway 

Shuttle Accessibility: 
Shuttles are accessible to people with disabilities. Some bus shuttles may be provided by third-party contractors and will look different than MBTA buses. Some may provide accessibility via a lift in the back rather than a ramp in front. 

See station personnel for assistance. Please visit mbta.com/RLwork for more info. 

Diversion not in effect Thanksgiving weekend: 
November 29 - December 1 

Diversion in effect these weekends: 
November 15 - 17 
November 22 - 24 
December 6 - 8 
December 13 - 15 

Affected stops: 
Kendall/MIT 
Charles/MGH 
Park Street 
Downtown Crossing 
South Station 
Broadway

attributes.description:
Due to MassDOT's Tobin Bridge/Chelsea Curves Rehabilitation Project, the Route 1 northbound lane closure will be extended through Chelsea and a southbound lane on the Tobin Bridge will be closed effective May 13. We expect this work will cause significant delays to buses on these roads, including Routes 111, 426, and 428. 

For the Routes 426 & 428, alternate service options include: 
Commuter Rail: For service to downtown Boston and connections to the Green and Orange Lines. Lynn Station (Zone 2 fare) is a 20-minute trip to North Station and daily parking is available for $2. 

Bus Routes: Inner Express Bus Routes 434 or 450, or local bus Routes 455 connect to downtown Boston and the Orange & Green Lines. Monthly Inner Express Bus passes are valid on these routes and local bus routes/subway. 

Subway: For the Orange Line, take the Route 430 bus from Saugus to Malden Center. For the Blue Line, take local bus Routes 110, 116, 117, 411, 424, 429, 441, 442, 455 or Inner Express Route 426W to Wonderland Station. Monthly Inner Express Bus pass valid for travel on subway and local bus. 

For more information on alternate routes and construction, visit www.mbta.com/tobinbridge

attributes.description:
The shuttle buses will operate on a normal train schedule but may experience delays up to 15 minutes. Due to severe weather conditions, there will no bus diversion between West Gloucester and Rockport on Monday December 2. 

Bicycles will not be allowed on shuttle buses. 

Normal train service is expected to resume on Monday December 23th, but additional weekdays may be added to the outage.

For additional information, please visit https://www.mbta.com/projects/gloucester-drawbridge-replacement

Affected stops:
Gloucester
Rockport

attributes.description:
This change is part of the second round of Better Bus Project service updates going into effect 
this year. 

Changes like this will help improve the reliability and flexibility of our bus system, and are based on feedback from over 3,000 MBTA bus riders like you, along with planners, drivers and consultants.

You can learn more about how were improving bus service throughout the region at mbta.com/betterbus
attributes.header: Starting December 22, 2019, Route 71 service includes new, short trips in the AM peak to Aberdeen Ave and PM peak to Harvard Square. To learn more about this change and view a map of changes, visit mbta.com/betterbus-71
